content: John Hodge (Mutabah) has marked this topic as resolved.
Fwiw lifetimes is not the only permissive aspect of impls w.r.t. trait contract: bounds on types can also be loosened in the impl
e.g., you can implement Hash without the : Hasher bound in the method, provided you don't require calling the hasher methods (e.g., for a zst type)
